citation.article-title: Delftia tsuruhatensis sp. nov., a terephthalate-assimilating bacterium isolated from activated sludge.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Delftia tsuruhatensis sp. nov.
Delftia tsuruhatensis (tsu.ru.ha.ten′sis. N.L. fem. adj. tsuruhatensis referring to Tsuruhata, Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan, where the type strain was isolated).
Gram-negative, motile, slightly curved, short rods (0·7–1·2×2·4–4·0 μm).
Cells occur individually or in pairs.
Growth occurs between 10 and 40 °C; optimum growth at 35 °C.
Growth occurs at pH 5·0–9·0; optimum growth at pH 7·0.
Doubling time is approximately 1·06 h under optimum growth conditions.
Positive for arginine dihydrolase, catalase, oxidase, lipase (Tween 80 hydrolysis) and urease activities and meta cleavage of protocatechuate.
Denitrification ability is not observed, although nitrate reduction is found.

The following compounds can be utilized as energy and carbon sources: acetamide, β-alanine, citrate, d-fructose, glycerol, isobutyrate, isophthalate, d(−)-mannitol, maleate, malonate, phenylacetate, propionate, protocatechuate, terephthalate, d-tryptophan and l-tryptophan.
The following compounds cannot be utilized: dl-3-aminobutyrate, d(+)-arabitol, catechol, 2,3-dihydroxybenzoate, d-glucose, lactose, phthalate, l-serine, starch, sucrose, l-valine and d(+)-xylose.
The most abundant fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1 and C18 : 1.
Cyclopropanoic acid (C17 : 0), 3-OH C10 : 0, C12 : 0, C15 : 0 and C14 : 0 are detected in smaller amounts.
The total DNA G+C content of the type strain is 66·2 mol%.
The type strain, T7T (=IFO 16741T=ATCC BAA-554T), was isolated from activated sludge in Tsuruhata, Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan.
